definition: abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate

sentences.english: Today China is proud and elated.
The Chinese people feel proud and elated for the great economic development/growth in China. The Chinese people feel proud and elated for China’s great economic development/growth.
sentences.chinese: 中国经济取得巨大发展，中国人民终于扬眉吐气了。

sentences.english: I have a successful career, such as the day is when I feel elated.
sentences.chinese: 等我事业有成的那天，也就是我扬眉吐气的时候。

sentences.english: Harry only raises an eyebrow, still unconvinced.
sentences.chinese: 只是扬了扬眉，还是不相信。

sentences.english: Rhodium-plated necklace with a Moonlight crystal in the exclusive Elated cut.
sentences.chinese: 铑镀金项链与月光晶体在独家扬眉吐气，削减。

sentences.english: Rhodium-plated drop pierced earrings with a Moonlight crystal in the exclusive Elated cut.
sentences.chinese: 铑镀下降，穿耳环与月光晶体在独家扬眉吐气，削减。

sentences.english: But then our fans erupted when we scored.
sentences.chinese: 当我们进球之后我们的球迷就扬眉吐气了。

sentences.english: At continued last China can avowal of a tennis player in a Grand Slam final.
sentences.chinese: 中国终于能够在网球大满贯赛上扬眉吐气了。

sentences.english: Now you have been acquitted on all the charges, you can hold your head high.
sentences.chinese: 现在你已被宣判无罪，你可以扬眉吐气了。

sentences.english: I made eye contact with the driver and he raised his brows.
sentences.chinese: 我对司机使了一个眼色，司机会意的扬了扬眉。

definition: to cast sidelong glances at sb
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to have a smile on one's face
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
to have heard what was said
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
